description.zh-cn: 香港三大地域之一，与中国大陆深圳市接壤，占香港陆地总面积接近90%。根据1898年《展拓香港界址专条》由英国向清朝租借，为期99年。
description.en: One of the three main regions of Hong Kong, bordering mainland China's Shenzhen, and accounting for nearly 90% of Hong Kong's total land area. It was leased by Britain from the Qing dynasty for 99 years under the 1898 Convention for the Extension of Hong Kong Territory.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的特别行政区，位于中国南部、珠江口以东，由香港岛、九龙和新界组成。
description.en: A Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China, located in southern China, east of the Pearl River estuary, consisting of Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories.

description.zh-cn: 位于欧洲的岛屿国家，曾在1898年至1997年间管治新界。
description.en: An island country in Europe that governed the New Territories from 1898 to 1997.

description.zh-cn: 中国最后一个帝制王朝，于1898年将新界租借予英国。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China, which leased the New Territories to Great Britain in 1898.

en: The Convention for the Extension of Hong Kong Territory

description.zh-cn: 1898年由英国与清朝在北京签订的条约，内容为租借新界99年。
description.en: A treaty signed in Beijing in 1898 between the United Kingdom and the Qing dynasty, leasing the New Territories for 99 years.

description.zh-cn: 第25任香港总督，任内推行十年建屋计划等重要政策，促成了新界的大规模发展。
description.en: The 25th Governor of Hong Kong, who implemented major policies such as the Ten-year Housing Programme, leading to the large-scale development of the New Territories.

description.zh-cn: 由港督麦理浩于1972年提出的公共房屋计划，旨在解决香港市民的居住问题，并直接推动了新界新市镇的发展。
description.en: A public housing program proposed by Governor MacLehose in 1972 to address the housing needs of Hong Kong's population, which directly drove the development of new towns in the New Territories.

description.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区政府发展局辖下的部门。其前身新界拓展署于1973年成立，负责执行新界的大规模发展计划。
description.en: A department under the Development Bureau of the Hong Kong SAR Government. Its predecessor, the New Territories Development Department, was established in 1973 to implement large-scale development plans in the New Territories.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末至二战期间的日本，曾于1941年至1945年占领香港。
description.en: Japan from the late 19th century until the end of World War II, which occupied Hong Kong from 1941 to 1945.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间，大日本帝国军事占领香港的时期，共计三年零八个月。
description.en: The period during World War II when Hong Kong was under military occupation by the Empire of Japan, lasting for three years and eight months.

description.zh-cn: 第12任香港总督，负责接管新界，并决定了对新界的间接管治方针。
description.en: The 12th Governor of Hong Kong, who was responsible for taking over the New Territories and decided on the policy of indirect rule for the area.

description.zh-cn: 香港辅政司，其关于新界的报告影响了英国对该地区的早期管治政策。
description.en: Colonial Secretary of Hong Kong, whose report on the New Territories influenced early British governance policies in the region.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国广东省的副省级市，与香港新界接壤。
description.en: A sub-provincial city in Guangdong Province, China, bordering the New Territories of Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上第一个大一统的封建王朝。秦朝平定百越之后，今天的新界被纳入其版图。
description.en: The first unified imperial dynasty in Chinese history. After the Qin conquered the Baiyue peoples, the area of the modern New Territories was incorporated into its territory.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代行政区划，秦朝时管辖范围包括今天的新界地区。
description.en: An ancient administrative division in China. During the Qin dynasty, its jurisdiction included the area of the modern New Territories.

description.zh-cn: 该条约的签订确立了英国租借新界99年的事实，并界定了新界的地理范围。
description.en: The signing of this treaty established the 99-year lease of the New Territories to Britain and defined its geographical scope.

description.zh-cn: 通过《展拓香港界址专条》租借并管治新界，直至1997年主权移交。
description.en: Leased and governed the New Territories through the Convention for the Extension of Hong Kong Territory until the 1997 handover.

description.zh-cn: 通过《展拓香港界址专条》将新界地区租借予英国，失去对该地区的管治权。
description.en: Lost sovereignty over the New Territories by leasing the area to Britain through the Convention for the Extension of Hong Kong Territory.

description.zh-cn: 港督卜力基于骆克的报告及建议，决定对新界采用间接管治的方针。
description.en: Governor Henry Blake decided to adopt a policy of indirect rule over the New Territories based on James Stewart Lockhart's report and recommendations.

description.zh-cn: 作为港督，决定对新界采用间接管治方针，维持其原有的土地财产制度和民间风俗习惯。
description.en: As Governor, he decided on a policy of indirect rule for the New Territories, maintaining its original land ownership system and local customs.

description.zh-cn: 时任港督麦理浩于1972年提出十年建屋计划，以解决房屋问题。
description.en: Then-Governor Crawford Murray MacLehose proposed the Ten-year Housing Programme in 1972 to solve the housing problem.

description.zh-cn: 为配合该计划，香港政府大举发展新界，开拓了多个新市镇，极大地改变了新界的面貌并使其人口剧增。
description.en: To facilitate this programme, the Hong Kong government extensively developed the New Territories, creating several new towns, which dramatically changed its landscape and led to a rapid population increase.

description.zh-cn: 其前身新界拓展署于1973年成立，专门负责执行新界的发展计划，包括开拓新市镇。
description.en: Its predecessor, the New Territories Development Department, was established in 1973 to specifically carry out development plans in the New Territories, including the creation of new towns.

description.zh-cn: 于1941年12月军事占领香港，开启了为期三年零八个月的统治。
description.en: Militarily occupied Hong Kong in December 1941, beginning a three-year and eight-month period of rule.

description.zh-cn: 日本占领期间，香港占领地政府于1943年7月起将新界分成7个区进行管辖，改变了原有的行政区划。
description.en: During the Japanese occupation, the Hong Kong Occupied Territory Government divided the New Territories into 7 districts for administration starting from July 1943, altering the original administrative divisions.

description.zh-cn: 秦朝平定百越之后，今天的新界被纳入为秦境，属番禺县管辖。
description.en: After the Qin dynasty conquered the Baiyue, the area of the modern New Territories was incorporated into Qin territory under the jurisdiction of Panyu County.

description.zh-cn: 新界是构成香港的三大地域之一。
description.en: The New Territories is one of the three main regions that constitute Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 新界与中国大陆的深圳市陆地接壤。
description.en: The New Territories shares a land border with the city of Shenzhen in Mainland China.
